lib
Class CommonNetConn<TYPE>

java.lang.Object
  lib.CommonNetConn<TYPE>
Type Parameters:
TYPE -
All Implemented Interfaces:
Config, CommonConfig, java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
NetConn, NetPacketConn
public abstract class CommonNetConn<TYPE>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, Config

this contains network code common to the legacy strings network, and the mixed string/binary packet used by the vnc network There are a small number of abstract methods that have to be implemented by all (ie; both) types of actual network connections. All the methods here are final only to prevent accidents in development. It runs a reader and writer process, driven by queues, and provides simple getInput and sendMessage interfaces.

Author:
Ddyer

Method Detail

setBufSize

public abstract void setBufSize(int n)
set the buffer size, which may be a limitation on the amount of data in a packet. There's no reason to low ball this number, but infinitely large packets are probably evidence of a runaway.

Parameters:
n -
